Summary I am a recent college graduate looking to pursue a career in either education, psychology, or both. I am passionate about working with children and am interested in their behaviors, thought processes, and how both their biological makeup and environment plays a role in these outcomes. Experience FRL/Bedside Volunteer Stanford Children's Health | Lucile Packard Children's Hospital Stanford August 2014  – Present (1 year 1 month) Palo Alto Administrative Assistant Stanford University School of Medicine October 2013  – Present (1 year 11 months) stanford university •Provide administrative support to Dr. Sudhof in organizing conferences and meetings, coordinating visitor schedules and helping with miscellaneous tasks as requested. 
•Responsible for ordering lab materials and equipment for graduate and postdoctoral lab members through Oracle Financial systems and HHMI; keep track of purchase orders and all purchasing expenses in detailed excel sheet. 
•Organize travel arrangements, maintain travel files, manage travel card and process travel reimbursements. Summer Intern Boys and Girls Club of the Peninsula June 2014  –  July 2014  (2 months) east palo alto • Worked as a summer intern at the BGCP East Palo Alto club house with 15-20 teenagers ages 14-17 years old 
• Taught the different skill sets necessary for volleyball and soccer and created lesson plans with games and team building activities to keep the kids engaged 
• Encouraged the kids to work together in order to achieve a common goal and practice good sportsmanship on and off the playing field Peer Life Coach Intern Creating Options and Conquering Hurdles (COACH) Program September 2012  –  June 2013  (10 months) UC Irvine Counseling Center •Trained as a life coach to help undergraduate students needing assistance with their academic, social and personal goals. 
•Assisted 7 students by helping them formulate individual plans with specific steps, tasks and timelines.  
•Contacted clients biweekly and provided them with wisdom and encouraged them to accomplish their goals. Discussion Leader Coordinator UC Irvine University Studies Discussion Leader Program March 2010  –  January 2013  (2 years 11 months) UC Irvine Department of Undergraduate Education • Worked with a team of 4 other coordinators and supervisor to create and help lead weekly, two hour long training courses covering topics such as public speaking, campus resources, time management, leadership, etc., for a group of 50 Discussion Leaders. 
• Held weekly coordinator meetings to brainstorm unique ways to present information that is both educationally stimulating and engaging. 
• Served as a positive role model, motivator and mentor for Discussion Leaders and Undergraduate students. Activity Coordinator/Volunteer Orangewood Children's Home October 2010  –  December 2012  (2 years 3 months) santa ana, ca •	Planned and supervised an activity night for boys and girls ages 6-10 and 11-14. 
•	Developed two-hour lesson plans around a pre-assigned theme. 
•	Provided a sense of support to children to help along their transition at Orangewood. •Helped Graduate and Post Doctoral lab fellows submit their research papers to reviewers. 
•Answered phone calls and was responsible for organizing conferences and helping individuals obtain documents or papers they needed. Front Desk Associate Fitness 19 July 2009  –  June 2012  (3 years) San Mateo, CA •	Entered membership data into computer system and updated billing information. 
•	Organized and maintained gym membership filing system and responsible for membership reconciliation. 
•	Helped trainers market and plan health challenges and events for their clients. Summary I was an account manager for five years for the Stanford Blood Center at Stanford University. My responsibilities were to recruitment new donors, accounts and management of existing accounts within the SF Bay Area. 
I am also experienced in “cold calling” techniques, networking, and other promotional activities to increase community adoption. I work independently to identify and contract blood donor groups for both mobile and center donations ensuring Blood Center objectives were met. I am a participant in community events such as health fairs to increase public education and awareness. In addition, I tailored recruitment programs to fit community needs. I developed many efforts to increase donor base such as donor retention programs, interacting with the media, minority recruitment, special events, and holiday promotions. 
I coordinated different events and activities with blood drive planners, field recruiters, media relations, collections and laboratory staff to assure smooth integration of all aspects relating to recruitment and drawing of donors. Summary • PROJECT COORDINATOR 
o Establish and maintain target goals and deadlines

o Organize large amounts of data into readable formats for distribution to team

project goals and deadlines; also to review documentation and exchange information 
o Adapt quickly to changing priorities and parameters 
o Use spreadsheets to organize, analyze, and track data 
o Industries: high tech, medical, and academic 
 
• WRITING AND EDITING 
o Expertise in writing and editing a broad range of technical documents, standard operating  
procedures, letters, and reports

reducing calls to technical support

o Test installation procedures of networking products, GUIs, and documentation 
o Reduce calls to customer support as a result 
o Worked in Agile environment

o Proficient with enterprise software including Oracle Financials and EPIC Experience Project Coordinator (Contract) Palo Alto Medical Foundation February 2014  –  September 2014  (8 months) Sunnyvale, CA Coordinate the training of PAMF physicians and mid-level employees to prepare for the switch from ICD-9 to ICD-10 diagnostic coding throughout the United States.  
•	Tracked completion of training (through online modules, videos, and in-person training) in spreadsheets. 
•	Tracked over 1500 participants. 
•	Communicated with five local hospitals to track their training of PAMF staff. 
•	Communicated daily with IT, facilities, catering, and support staff for in-person training sessions. 
•	Analyzed data to determine project’s progress and sent updates to directors. 
•	Coordinated training sessions on nine sites. 
•	Incorporated changing parameters into the schedule. 
•	Wrote and edited documentation for RAF auditing department (policy and procedures, etc.) 
•	Wrote User Guide for internal RAF audit program. 
•	Worked in EPIC to gather chart records for patients for coding department. 
•	Communicated EPIC software problems to SutterHealth IT.
